event.title: 1839 the London-based Secondary Towns Association, represented

data.event: In 1839 the London-based Secondary Towns Association, represented in Adelaide by John Morphett and John Hill, authorised expenditure on the special survey a proposed town to be named Wellington, with prior consent of the Duke of Wellington himself.

event.title: carried out the survey in November 1840

data.event: Messrs Cannan and Henderson carried out the survey in November 1840 and the first lots were sold in July 1841.
Messrs Cannan and Henderson carried out the survey in November 1840 and the first lots were sold in July 1841.
